meanings.definition: A person who speaks on behalf of another or a group.
meanings.sent1: The company's official spokesperson, known as the mouthpieces, addressed the media.
meanings.sent2: The mouthpieces of the team always convey the coach's messages to the players.
meanings.sent3: The mouthpieces for the charity event made sure to spread the word effectively.
meanings.sent4: As the mouthpieces of the organization, they eloquently represent its values.
meanings.sent5: The mouthpieces' persuasive speeches inspired many to join the cause.

meanings.definition: The part of a musical instrument that is placed against the lips to produce sound.
meanings.sent1: The trumpet player carefully cleaned the mouthpieces before the performance.
meanings.sent2: The saxophonist adjusted the mouthpieces to achieve the perfect tone.
meanings.sent3: The band members joked about mixing up their mouthpieces during practice.
meanings.sent4: The shiny brass mouthpieces gleamed under the stage lights.
meanings.sent5: The musician's skilled fingers swiftly changed the mouthpieces during the song.
